Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "$emit passes arrays by reference" (#7441) at vuejs/vue
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
2.5.13

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/morficus/7f56ogLm/1/](https://jsfiddle.net/morficus/7f56ogLm/1/)

### Steps to reproduce
Once you open the JSFiddle link:

1. Mark some check boxes from with in the "child" container
2. Click the "notify parent" button - this will emit an event
3. Watch how the counter in the parent event updates
4. Now click the "Pop It!" button - this just does a ".pop" on the local data
5. Notice now the check-boxes in the child component are affected...

### What is expected?
When clicking the "Pop It!" button, the counter in the parent should go down with out affecting the child component selection.

### What is actually happening?
The child component selection is being affected.

---
It appears that when passing an array as an additional argument to `$emit` ... only a reference to the array is passed around. I tried doing the same with objects in place of arrays and was not able to create the issue.

I was expecting for a copy of the array to be passed with `$emit`, not a reference.

This seems like a way to "cheat" two-way binding between parent-child components :-p

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "$emit passes arrays by reference" (#7441) at vuejs/vue
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
2.5.13

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/morficus/7f56ogLm/1/](https://jsfiddle.net/morficus/7f56ogLm/1/)

### Steps to reproduce
Once you open the JSFiddle link:

1. Mark some check boxes from with in the "child" container
2. Click the "notify parent" button - this will emit an event
3. Watch how the counter in the parent event updates
4. Now click the "Pop It!" button - this just does a ".pop" on the local data
5. Notice now the check-boxes in the child component are affected...

### What is expected?
When clicking the "Pop It!" button, the counter in the parent should go down with out affecting the child component selection.

### What is actually happening?
The child component selection is being affected.

---
It appears that when passing an array as an additional argument to `$emit` ... only a reference to the array is passed around. I tried doing the same with objects in place of arrays and was not able to create the issue.

I was expecting for a copy of the array to be passed with `$emit`, not a reference.

This seems like a way to "cheat" two-way binding between parent-child components :-p

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Add global query params to every router link" (#1982) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody: In som cases, it's needed to add global query params to every router link to keep state, so I want to know how to add global query params to every router link in a single page application?

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "afterEach is never run when redirecting with next()" (#1981) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://codepen.io/anon/pen/ypjMNx](https://codepen.io/anon/pen/ypjMNx)

### Steps to reproduce
1. Click on the router link "go to other route".

### What is expected?
1. beforeEach hook should be called and "before: /other-route" should be logged to console
2. user should be redirected to '/'
3. afterEach hook should be called and "after: /other-route" should be logged to console

### What is actually happening?
1. beforeEach hook is being called and "before: /other-route" is logged to console
2. user gets redirected to '/'

---
This only happens if the user gets redirected to the page he is coming from (e.g.: user coming from '/' and going to '/other-route', but gets immediately redirected to '/').

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "fix(types): allow a function type for root `state` option" (#1132) at vuejs/vuex
Events.RelatedBody: This PR allows to pass a function for root `state` option as same as modules in TypeScript.
